maml:description.maml:para: A brief description of the Set-CapaSchedule function.
A detailed description of the Set-CapaSchedule function.
The name of the package
Package version
Type of package

The Schedule start date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm" eg. "2015-04-15 12:05"
yyyy - Year with century. MM - Numeric month with a leading zero. dd - Numeric day of the month with a leading zero. HH - 24 Hour clock with leading zero. mm - Minutes with leading zero.

The Schedule start date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm" eg. "2015-04-15 12:05". If no end date is wanted leave the string empty. e.g. ""
yyyy - Year with century. MM - Numeric month with a leading zero. dd - Numeric day of the month with a leading zero. HH - 24 Hour clock with leading zero. mm - Minutes with leading zero.

The Schedule Interval begin time in the format HH:mm" eg. "06:00". If left empty it is set to 00:00
HH - 24 Hour clock with leading zero. mm - Minutes with leading zero.

The Schedule Interval end time in the format HH:mm" eg. "12:00". If left empty it is set to 00:00
HH - 24 Hour clock with leading zero. mm - Minutes with leading zero.

The Schedule Recurrence for the schedule.
Possible values:
"Once" "PeriodicalDaily", use the variable ScheduleRecurrencePattern detail this recurrence "PeriodicalWeekly", use the variable ScheduleRecurrencePattern detail this recurrence "Always"

Is used to further detail the Schedule Recurrence when set to PeriodicalDaily or PeriodicalWeekly
Possible values:
ScheduleRecurrence = "PeriodicalDaily" ScheduleRecurrencePattern = "RecurEveryWeekDay" sets the recurrence pattern to run every weekday ScheduleRecurrencePattern = "" Sets the recurrence pattern to recur every day including weekend days. ScheduleRecurrence = "PeriodicalWeekly" ScheduleRecurrencePattern = "1,3,5" Will set the schedule pattern to run
